tags: ALSO HE WAS BLOND WHICH. DISTURBS ME ON A PRIMAL LEVEL
summary: Honestly anyone else feel as if the Perfect Peter Parker of Miles’ universe was like. Not Disastrous enough to be spiderman??...
body: Honestly anyone else feel as if the Perfect Peter Parker of Miles’ universe was like. Not Disastrous enough to be spiderman?? Where is the dumbassery. The foolishness. That blond-haired beautiful young man looked like he had his whole life put together: he was in a stable loving relationship, he was not emotionally constipated and he quite clearly knew what he was doing. That is the most ooc interpretation of spiderman that I have ever seen on screen in I’m being honest

reblog.comment: Honestly anyone else feel as if the Perfect Peter Parker of Miles’ universe was like. Not Disastrous enough to be spiderman?? Where is the dumbassery. The foolishness. That blond-haired beautiful young man looked like he had his whole life put together: he was in a stable loving relationship, he was not emotionally constipated and he quite clearly knew what he was doing. That is the most ooc interpretation of spiderman that I have ever seen on screen in I’m being honest

That blond-haired beautiful young man looked like he had his whole life put together: he was in a stable loving relationship, he was not emotionally constipated and he quite clearly knew what he was doing. That is the most ooc interpretation of spiderman that I have ever seen on screen in I’m being honest

That blond-haired beautiful young man looked like he had his whole life put together: he was in a stable loving relationship, he was not emotionally constipated and he quite clearly knew what he was doing. That is the most ooc interpretation of spiderman that I have ever seen on screen in I’m being honest

summary: Could you do Headcanons for dating Peter Parker???
question: Could you do Headcanons for dating Peter Parker???
answer:
Of course sweet nonny ♥

A/N: My first Peter Parker headcanons!! And this is so looooong.

I made these pre-game-based so I wouldn’t spoil anything :) And I actually researched a bunch of Peter Parker’s life because I wanted to include some of his high school/college times :D And for the future: If I don’t find enough of gifs for PS4 Peter Parker, I might use a movie Spider-Man gifs with a suit on c:

And in case you read this/encounter my blog for the first time through this, and want to request a Peter Parker x reader; please note that I haven’t seen any Spider-Man movies. I have only played the game which was released last autumn. I’ll try to watch some Marvel movies though in the future, if I manage to muster enough time (+ money) to buy and watch them.

—

  • You met Peter at the high school, when you were both 10.
  • He was this super-nerdy and intelligent know-it-all-person in class.
  • Not that it bothered you, you just thought it was cute how he always knew all kinds of things and was the first to answer in class. Though almost everyone in your school thought he was just being snobby when he was just so shy.
  • And of course, you developed a crush on him even before you had talked to him at all, because typical crush™.
  • Eventually, you befriended Peter at the middle of high school – and you were the only friend he had for some time.
  • You were the first person who found out him having Spider-Man powers, because he accidentally kept blurting webs from his wrists from time to time, since he couldn’t control it fully at first.
  • And you had to reassure him for the whole day because of it, because he was sure you would abandon him and think he was a freak.
  • And you maybe ended up cuddling on the sofa as you were reassuring him…
  • And he maybe kissed you for the first time that night…
  • A week after that night, he was extremely nervous about it, but he finally asked you to go on a date with him.
  • After a few dates and spectacular food (minus those dumplings) you officially started dating.
  • After Peter told you he wanted to begin to help people as “Spider-Man”, you were tense at the thought at first, because you were sure Peter would come home in a coffin if he starts doing that.
  • And fortunately, he listened to you and suggested training for a year (or he suggested two weeks, you insisted two years and you eventually came to a conclusion of one year) before going into action.
  • You rented an old garage and built a training ground there.
  • And as Peter trained, you sketched the very first Spider-Man costume for him.
  • And on his spare time when not training, he built web shooters and such to himself and sometimes he made nice comments about your costume sketches.
  • He had to get rid of his fear of heights for the very last occasion for his training. You challenged him to climb to the very top of the Empire State Building. And after days and days of persuading and eventually promising him a pizza on your account if he does it, he very reluctantly agreed to do it, but in his words, it was only because “that pizza card is unfair, you know?”. And he actually did it, (though it took an hour) and sent you a pic while he was there.
  • “I did it, is the pizza coming? I’m starving!” he had written as the text with the picture.
  • And when he first went out to test his powers, people thought it was an advertisement for a circus which was coming to town later that week. Everyone was taking pictures as Peter was just swinging there and he enjoyed the attention. That was something you had never seen him enjoy. He made some funny jokes while there – and that was the other thing he had changed on.
  • And even though Peter had changed a lot in a year, and you had fallen in love with a shy and nerdy boy, you now had fun and a lot bolder boyfriend. But you loved him nevertheless.
  • He soon helped the world in two ways – he worked as a lab assistant for Otto Octavius, who had a project of making hi-tech limb prosthetics for disabled people and other times, he was swinging by his web and stopping crimes all around the city. You helped people by doing voluntary work at F.E.A.S.T.
  • And btw, Peter’s aunt loved you being together too. She said you did good to Peter and said she trusted you to not let Peter get in real trouble. She didn’t say what she meant by that but… you believed you knew.

reblog.comment:
Of course sweet nonny ♥

summary: Amazing Spider-Man (Vol. 1) #357 Writer: Al Milgrom, Pencils: Mark Bagley
